content: apple bag designed by lisa hounshell this pattern uses breakaway crochet method techniques if you haven t done so already please refer to the following instructional material before attempting this pattern for the basic techniques start by either downloading the free training wheels primer ebook from ravelry or by watching this video for a demonstration of techniques used in this specific project please watch this youtube video materials yarn 2 balls bella baby tootgarook 4 ply cotton each ball = 1 76 ounces / 50 gm 159 yards / 145 metres hook us size d / 3 25 mm stitch markers measurements width approximately 12 inches / 30 cm height approximately 11 inches / 28 cm without handles gauge each motif measured from side to side = 1 / 2 5 cm abbreviations us terminology slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet cluster double_crochet 3 together fcluster floating cluster- yarn over make floating ring yarn over and pull through 2 loops on hook yarn over insert hook into floating ring and draw through loop yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook twice yarn over and draw through 4 loops on hook pattern notes this bag is made up of very small square motifs similar to the first round of a granny square but with these exceptions you will be working clusters double_crochet 3 together instead of the normal 3 double crochets and there are 4 chain stitches in each corner instead of the usual 2 or 3 additionally since you will be using breakaway techniques each motif starts with a floating ring and the motifs are worked continuously in row the motifs are established on foundation row and finished on return row the bag has a flat rectangular base which gives it a roomy boxy shape and bear in mind that like most mesh market bags it will still stretch adding a lining is the best solution if you are concerned about the bag keeping its shape you can easily modify the size of the bag by changing the width or height of the base and/or by changing the number of row on the sides instructions all stitches are worked into the floating ring of the indicated motif unless otherwise stated start by making the base of the bag which is a rectangle 8 motifs in a row x 3 row first foundation row * begin new motif fcluster chain 4 cluster chain 4 repeat from * 7 more times 8 motifs established first return row continuing around current motif * cluster chain 4 cluster chain 2 slip_stitch around next chain 4 chain 2 continue to next motif repeat from * along row to last motif in last motif cluster chain 4 second foundation row fcluster chain 4 * begin next motif fcluster chain 2 slip_stitch into next chain 4 space chain 2 cluster chain 4 repeat from * to end of row second return row continuing around current motif * cluster chain 4 cluster chain 2
